nameOrigin.pour: to drop or flow liquid (referring to cooking and its Water type)

Simipour.desc: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
